name: Bruce Jones
text: Absolutely with out a doubt the BEST place to get welder certified

name: chris williams
text: These guys know how to get stuff done. One stop shop for any and all metal needs. They are expanding services all the time. If these guys dont do it already, they will figure out how.

name: aaron johnson
text: Consummate professionals these folks really know their metal

name: Deborah Cooper
text: Great engineers, fantastic metallurgical testing facility.

name: Ralph Lindsey
text: Professional in every aspect...

name: Chris Todd
text:
Very personable, friendly doctor and staff. Was extremely thorough in evaluation and testing for my illness. Even got friendly  follow up call the next morning to see how I was doing.
Highly recommended.

name: Rebecca Fox
text: Very kind nurses and informative doctor. Doctor was professional but had a great “bedside manor”. Visit was very quick. Highly recommend!

name: Ian Hunter
text: The staff is nice, and the doctor is nice. They’re efficient. However any billing problems you have, are a nightmare. Be aware of if your insurance only covers your visit with a referral, or you’ll be paying out of pocket.

name: Priscillla J
text: Very  efficient.  They even called few days later to check on my child.....

name: Brandon King
text: The staff is very nice— no wait time and the doctor is knowledgeable

name: Jennifier Barger
text: I WAS REFUSED CARE. Today I went to Summit Express Care to have a physical done for a form I needed to fill out. There was a question about the way they bill--I asked them to try to bill through my insurance, and they refused. I decided to go ahead with the process anyway. I was called up and told that because of a previous experience I had, they refused to see me. I was shocked, because while I do remember the receptionist being rude in the past, I did not remember any major altercation. Not to mention, even if I had ever gotten frustrated, I would never have been mean or threatening in any way. I said it was shocking that they would refuse care. based on some past frustration. She said it's a private physician-owned clinic and they can see whomever they want. I asked to speak to the person making the decision and was told it was the physician who owns the clinic. Understand, I have also had good experiences there, so I'm not sure why I didn't get credit for those. Anyway, I was told she refused to see me and was told I could leave my contact information, but with no assurance that I would actually be called. The receptionist told me that it was based on a review I had written before. I cannot find any reviews I have ever written. My husband wrote one based on the same kind of deal with the refusal to even try to work with our insurance process because they think they know what will be covered, 19 months ago. I said, "I'm sorry, but since I can't even remember what the details are that would prompt me to write a bad review, that happened at least 19 months ago, it would seem that you could let by-gones be by-gones." I was told once again they could see whomever they wanted. I was not told what I had written, what the issues were, nor where I had written a negative review.  As I left, I did tell the receptionist that since I was not being given the courtesy of an explanation, that I was left with no choice but to leave a bad review, and she agreed that that would be fine. I would much rather have had a conversation.  As a health care professional myself, I cannot imagine not seeing someone just because they got frustrated one time in the past.  Also, it seems that bad reviews would prompt one to address the issues rather than fire the patients.

name: B L
text: We had a very good experience here. The receptionist was SO KIND. She went above and beyond to help us. The dr was very direct and well spoken. Nurses were kind. Fastest service ever at an urgent care.

name: Johnny Birge
text:
One of the rudest facilities I have EVER been to. The nursing staff was the most UNPROFESSIONAL I have encountered. Their manner of speaking to the patient, their lack of privacy, and their general practice as health care providers left me in utter disbelief!
The doctor did seem much more professional however.

name: Megan McDonald
text: I had the BEST experience here. The staff is awesome and Dr. Pettway was very sweet and made me feel really listened too. I will definitely switch from using American Family Care. Highly recommend this place!

name: rachel mathai
text: This office is very professional and very quick. I felt extremely comfortable in seeking medical care and received by far the best medical care in awhile. If needed I will definitely return and honestly I am very grateful for the care I received while I was there.

name: Brad Dixon
text: Just called today to ask a few questions prior to my visit and the woman who answered the phone was so incredibly rude. Spoke over me and didn't care to listen to my questions. Mighty fine first impression. I'll never go here.

name: bo thuston
text: In the past two years I have been there many times to have my blood pressure checked - always fast and friendly. Not today, there's a witch up front who wants to know " why do you want it checked ? " Duh!  After some more runaround from her I went elsewhere. Hope she was temporary because it's convenient and always been nice before.

resp.text: We see your post and our records confirm that you have never been seen at our clinic. It seems you have mistaken us and have us confused with a different clinic. You are welcome to contact us to see if we can be of service to you.

name: Richann Stage
text: Pleasant place to go when you aren't feeling well. Nice, friendly staff. Doctors are great too. Quick visits, knowledgeable staff and no billing issues. The follow up phone calls are a nice bonus.

name: mike chapman
text: Summit Express was recommended by a coworker after frustratingly long wait times to see a clinician. I have been going to Summit express for a few years now and always have gotten in to see a doctor in less than 5 minutes. Great staff, efficient service!

name: Christina Gammage
text: I have been employed there for about 7 months now. I absolutely love being a Medical Assistant here. Mr. Pettway and Dr. Pettway provide so much growth to new Medical Assistants. The practice is a busy practice and it requires the type of employees that are fast, efficient and have  the ability to multitask  with a smile. Dr. Pettway is an excellent Physician and an awesome boss. I know that I will definitely work here until she decide to retire.

name: Jamey S
text:
Staff was not very friendly or helpful. Called around looking for cash prices for my daughter who lives near there. Dr Petway’s staff was very annoyed with having to answer my questions and would not describe their services offered. (Seems they treat coughs) The cash fee was high I thought at $150. They put me on hold multiple times and finally just hung up on me. I did call back, and it was clear they had hung up on me.

Just really rude, discourteous treatment, and an apparent disconnect from the free market and how hard I have to work for the $150 one would assume they need people to bring in and turn over to them. I just work too hard for my money to spend it with people who treat me like that. So I went to Med Help for $100. Lower price and more dignified treatment of the customer.

name: Carole Murray
text: There was not a long wait.  The receptionist and nurse were professional and thorough. The doctor made sure I understood all of the discharge instructions.  I will come back.

name: Nora Gilchrist
text:
The Dr listened and had a good grasp on the problem. I have allergies which makes it hard to treat with a number of medicines but he quickly found alternatives. The nurses wasted no time...very knowledgeable and kind.

This clinic was clean and well kept. And I am thankful that I found it for future needs for my family.

name: Ashten Dick
text: Love Dr. Pettway and the nurses at Summit Express! Been going to them for years, even more so than my primary physician. They’re hours fit my work schedule, the wait is always short, and it’s very clean! I definitely recommend visiting this urgent care!

name: Kay Wins
text: Nice facility. Good hours. Fast service. The staff was knowledgeable and friendly. They even called to follow up on how I was feeling after my visit!

name: The Larry Russo Trio Russo
text: Labor day weekend! No other patients! Dr. there told me to go to the E.R ! How this ? got in medical school is scary! we all aware that medical malpractice is 3rd leading cause of death in the U.S  I have never been diagnosed without being seen? I would recommend AMERICAN Family Care if you are sick!! Hopefully you won't waste your time with mystical powers of medicine

name: Jeremy Williams
text:
Not worth the time ...... just go to the pharmacy it's more helpful!

Response to summit: I have bcbs of Alabama premier plan so .... next excuse? And your front desk clerk is rude.

resp.text: We are sorry but we are unable to participate with every insurance plan.

name: Robin Battles
text: Dr. Pettway and all her staff are courteous, friendly & caring. While extremely professional  & efficient, no long wait period, they take time to listen. And best is the excellent diagnosing & treatment. I highly recommend!!

name: Andrea Hays
text: It was a very pleasant experience! They were so friendly and got me in and out! I would definitely recommend this urgent care!

name: Sandra Hood
text: Very clean. Very professional. Very courteous. Very kind. We were traveling and developed shingles and I could not have asked for better care.

name: April Simpson
text: My family and I always have the best experience at Summit Express in Vestavia. The doctors and everyone working there are so pleasant and helpful. Dr. Pettway has become our ‘go-to’ doctor for urgent care. I can’t recommend this business enough!

name: Robin Brooks
text: Got me in and out quickly. Staff was down to earth and made me laugh. My nurse felt like i had know her for years. Dr was to the point and thorough. Excellent!.

name: IBK
text: Awesome staff... fast, courteous and knowledgeable. Accurate diagnosis and correct prescriptions assigned based on diagnosis.

name: Johanna Kron
text: Great doctors, perfect bedside manner. Will help treat the symptoms that need the treatment, while also guiding you to long term preventative solutions. Best urgent care in town!

name: Latoya Hood
text: This was my second time visiting Summit Express Urgent Care. Both times were great experiences for me. The care I recieved when I arrived until the time I left was excellent. Very professional! Clean facility! Great Staff! Dr Pettaway was funny polite and made me feel at ease. I highly recommend this Urgent Care to everyone. You want regret it!

name: sara mahaffey
text: Excellent service!  Never a long wait, fabulous staff and doctor.  Always receive a check up call the next day to make sure how I'm feeling and ate meds working.  Recommend Summit to everyone I know.

name: Candace Bivens
text: I give Summit Express Urgent Care 2 thumbs up! I was experiencing foot pain after a fall and drove by the clinic and decided to stop by. First the waiting room was very clean, and I was immediately greeted by the nurse upon entering. She made me feel so welcome. She even walked the paperwork to me since my foot was hurting. Even though I was a walk in and others were there needing medical attention, I was able to go into a room and speak with a nurse within 10 min! X-rays were needed, done and evaluated in a very timely manor! I really loved my experience. There was little to no wait time, and the staff was very professional and courteous. I will not hesitate to go back if I have another urgent need in the future!! Everyone needs to go to Summit Express Urgent Care!

name: Frank Scott
text: The staff at Summit Express is completely unprofessional and lacking in basic healthcare knowledge. According to their published mission statement, "We will apply innovative concepts and techniques to ensure the best possible outcomes for our patients." They stop way short of innovative when they are apparently unaware that a single prescribed antibiotic is not necessarily effective for every patient. A layperson can find this information with a quick Google search. Even when this information was pointed out, there was a point blank refusal to find a antibiotic that would work for the unrelenting symptoms. I strongly recommend that patients find an alternative to this urgent care facility.

name: Holly Johnson
text: Dr. Pettway and her staff are awesome!  So professional and very efficient.  Added bonus: they always make a courtesy call the next day to check on the patient.

name: Tish Tillis
text: Very friendly staff and very efficient. I highly recommend Summit Clinic!

name: Caleb Cole
text: They have an amazing group. Very excellent.

name: Ross U
text: Have visited multiple times over the last 2 to 3 years. Pollen and ragweed allergies bring often cases of strep and/or ear infections and the staff has always been quick, kind and pleasant. Never had to wait long. I never hesitate to return.

name: Scott G
text: Great experience!  They were kind, curious and proficient.  It was my first visit and will definitely go back.  MSG

name: Carli Small
text: Really top notch quality for an urgent care.  I have been twice and have never spent more than an hour, which included thorough testing and a doctor who actually listened.  Hardly any wait. Highly recommend.

name: Sherry Armstrong
text: They were fast and efficient and very friendly.  And I feel much better today.  Will definitely go back when the need arises.

name: Lucy Gilmore
text: I have the most respect for Dr. Pettway, her nurses, and her staff.  Thank you for quickly getting me in and diagnosing me.  It is nice to know that you are in Vestavia Hills.

name: Ryas Esdale
text: If you are trying to decide which Urgent Care to go to, choose this one. All of the staff is incredibly friendly, and they are so attentive to your symptoms. Dr. Pettway gave me exactly what I needed, and I have felt so much better since I left. A big thank you to their staff and if I am ever sick again I know where I will be going!

name: Jan Bradford
text: Great place for urgent care.  Was seen quickly, very caring and super clean facility.

name: Alexis (Lexi) Tackaberry
text: Made an appointment and when I was called back I told my symptoms (I had mono). I said I just wanted to have a mono test done. She said okay we can definitely do one of those. Then the doctor comes in and announces I’m dehydrated and needed to go to the ER. She denied my service. I went and I was not severely dehydrated but I do have a positive test for mono. This places should be monitored. As a med student, that nasty doctor should never see any other patient.

name: J Freeman
text: My family and I have all used these guys multiple times and had great experiences every time fast friendly get you in and out and get you well!!! Thanks so much!!

name: Todd Breckenridge
text: They saw both my boys in back to back days when we were traveling and were great.  Very friendly and accommodating. Would reccomend going if needed.

name: Katie Poole
text: Always easy to get in and out in a timely manner and always well take care of.

name: Jody Thrash
text: I filled out the paperwork online and then was asked almost the same questions by the nurse who then wrote down incorrect answers. When asked about past surgeries, I said I had my tubes tied and she wrote down hysterectomy. On my release paperwork, it said I was in menopause when I was there for strep and it was never discussed and I am most certainly NOT menopausal. Making up things about someone or documenting incorrect information on my medical records is not cool. I was not better by mid-week and was told to call back if that was the case. I do so and all they told me to do was come in and see another doctor. If your rotating staff refuse to treat patients seen by someone else in your practice, I can go see my ACTUAL doctor and  get better comprehensive care. This place was a waste of my time and money. Will not be back and will warn all I know to stay far away.

name: Denise Bivin
text: Had good service there until our last visit. Now I won’t go back. Not only did my child get worse after going but the injection site is still swollen and there’s a knot under her skin. The receptionist is rude and unhelpful. We had to go somewhere else to be correctly diagnosed and treated.

name: S Ireland
text: Today was the Second time I visited Summit express urgent care.  It is very clean, time efficient, and the friendly staff takes time to explain test results and prescriptions. Both times I was there approx 45 minutes, start to finish.

name: Tina Monroe
text: I highly recommend SEUC.  I was in and out in an hour.  The entire staff were pleasant and very helpful.  The Dr is one of the best doctors I've ever seen. I will definitely use them again.

name: Shannan Easter
text: Dr. Pettway and her nurses are friendly, fast and professional. It's a great, clean place to go when you need a doc in a hurry.

name: Phillip adams
text: The doctor and nurses were very friendly and accommodating. We arrived shortly before closing and they saw myself and young daughter.

name: Katrice Gilder
text: I went in on yesterday for the first time because of pain I'd been having most of the week in my right toe, I was quickly checked in and seen. The front clerk noticed that I sounded congested and suggested I get that looked into as well while I was there and I did. Everyone was so nice and friendly and I was thoroughly looked at and out in bout 45mins. Will definitely be coming back for any future needs.

name: Caroline Wright
text: I wish I could give ZERO stars!  I paid $150 cash for my visit only to be referred to someone else.  The doctor would not listen!

name: Calvin Gray
text: My wife and two daughters were just turned away and refused to treat them because we didn't have every penny of the "contracted amount" between them and my insurance provider. REFUSED to bill me like every other doctor or urgent care that we have visited in the past year, and who I've paid like always. We won't be going back there ever.  Not everybody has $500 to spare these days, at least we dont being a one income family, but they sure are gonna make you pay it or send you away sick.  So much for do no harm right?  I wonder how they would feel if they were in the same position? Probably just as appalled and mad as I am.

name: Sonya Wilson
text: Dr. Pettway and her staff and Summit Express have practically become our go to Family Medicine stop! They are so helpful and even take the time to follow up the next day to see how you are feeling. This is so much more than a regular Urgent Care place!

name: Amy Bromberg
text: This place is AMAZING!!! My husband and I have been in separately and saw different doctors, but both of us had a wonderful experience! We were each seen quickly, diagnosed properly, treated and out the door within an hour. Today, I went in with my kids for the first time (ages 1 and 2). Again, we were seen quickly, diagnosed, and treated. The entire staff is fabulous. I cannot say enough good things about the nurses, especially. One of them physically sat on the floor with my child to administer a breathing treatment. Previously with breathing treatments at another facility, I've been left alone with a screaming child and a face mask. That was not the case today! Really, her telling me "It's ok" as he climbed out of my lap and she sat on the floor with him just blew me away. Another nurse administered the breathing treatment to my other child, and he usually hates them! Not a test was shed! So thankful for them!!! I wish they'd be our Primary Care-the overall experience is lightyears better than any I've experienced both as an adult and with my kids!

name: Brian Johnson
text: We were in town visiting and my wife's sinus congestion required immediate attention. Dr. Pettway was outstanding in her promptness, kindness and her sense of humor. Melanie, the young lady who assisted us, had a personality and bedside manner that complimented Dr. Pettway's. I highly recommend this clinic. We were in and out within in 1 hour.

name: Shann Mincey
text: Clean nice people very quick!  Best urgent care that I’ve ever been to.

name: Tiffany Solomon
text: Exceptional and Quick Service Always!! Dr. Pettway and staff are Awesome!

name: Rhonda
text: We took my mother in law in to have her urine checked for a UTI.. We even called ahead to let them know we were coming in to check for UTI.  The doctor had the nurse come in and tell us after we got there that she would not check for a UTI.... and they were closing in 7 minutes. The doctor offered no reason... Luckily we found another medical care place that stayed open until 8pm...We will never return to Summit Express!

name: Jimmy Stout
text: In and out with no issues. Medical Assistant had excellent rapport

name: Kristy Flynn
text: They saw my daughter because the pediatrician's office could not get her in until late in the day.  They were great here!

name: Sam Mary Frances Bowles
text: Clean facility, personable and efficient staff, doctor was so nice and did not rush out of my room. Will recommend them from now on.

name: Casey Pilgrim
text: The wait was next to nothing, the staff was very friendly, and the doctor was very easy to deal with.  I had given up on urgent care facilities, but when my arm started bothering me, I decided to give Dr. Pettway a visit and see what happened.  My experience was very pleasant, and my visit was no longer than it needed to be...no waiting for an hour in the lobby, no waiting in the patient room for another hour, nothing.  I was in and out without any problems.  I would highly recommend to anyone looking to not lose an entire day at the doctor's office for something that shouldn't take more than an hour.  I was in and out, including x-rays, in 45 minutes flat.  No one likes to go to the doctor, but if I have to go again, this is where I'm going.

name: Linda Evans
text: They are always quick in getting you in to see the doctor. You never have to wait very long.

name: S N
text: Avoid this place like the plague. Unprofessional and incompetent. I have had better service at a fast food restaurant.

name: Anna Kate Lucas
text: So kind! I had to get multiple shots and strep and flu tests and they were very gentle

name: C P
text: This was the most pleasant urgent care experience I have ever had.  Thank you SEUC for your skill and exemplary customer service.

name: Tracey Flitcroft
text: Have gone twice within 8 months of each visit and turned away while signing my name because of my symptoms and each time I'm told to go to the emergency room. So lesson to those out there don't go here if you have a stomach virus let alone have a hinkling you are ill.

name: Besther Dubose
text: This is the best urgent care facility I have ever visited. They are always fast, friendly and accurate.

name: Aislynn Thomas
text: My mom works there Chablis King and she is great she makes everybody feel better.

name: Jen McCorkle
text:
I gave one star because it was the ONLY Option.

Do NOT go Here. The MD Dr Pettaway refused to see me because I had a dermatological issue-  due to severe allergies. .... It was humiliating to be refused care. She was unprofessional and unethical in doing so. She didn't even examine me. Her assistant did. Last time I checked MA's do not have Medical Degrees in Medicine.

Complete waste of My Time and my Energy when not feeling well. Being insulted and turned away is a first for me ..... I've spent years in the medical field myself - shocked.

name: Susan Pannell
text: Knowledgeable and super kind staff.  Dr Pettway is an excellent and caring physician.

name: Leslie King
text: Great fast care for my entire family.

name: Laura Ezell
text: Summit Express is very friendly, and effective. Highly recommend!!

name: M M
text:
I have never before been denied basic service (a work-related physical) by a doctor, but it happened here.  After taking time off from work and calling ahead to verify that this office does employment physicals, the nurse informed me that Dr. Pettway was "uncomfortable" with doing my annual physical.  Given that there were signs up in the lobby advertising for pre-employent and school-related physicals, it is clear to me that I was being discriminated against for some reason that was not communicated.

Avoid this doctor if you value your time and self-respect.

name: Chelsea Ryles
text: Refused care due to a pulled muscle in the back ...I’ve literally never heard of an urgent care not seeing someone for a pulled muscle ..I’ve been to several that have ...Dr. Didn’t even come out to explain ...

name: Cella Long (cella)
text: Nice staff, quality care.

name: austin ward
text: These people don't know what the heck they are talking about. I went in having a allergic reaction. For starters the desk clerk starts spouting off what she thinks the diagnosis is before I can even sign in. That should have been red flag number one. The "Doctor" calls me back, looks at my arm for literally 5 seconds and tells me I have cellulitis. She never physically touched me or took my vitals. She refuses to treat me and directs me to an emergency room. Upon arriving at the er I'm immediately put on "fast track". The diagnosis, an allergic reaction. Thank you summit emergency for costing me $2000 to get some antibiotics. Worst walk in clinic in bham, period. I only went to this clinic because of the great reviews they had in comparison to the others in town. Don't be fooled. The medhelp on columbiana and lakeshore or the afc on 280 are much better clinics with much more knowledgeable doctors. I know from experience.

name: Amber Huie
text: I went in because I was having some numbness in my eyebrow. Dr. Pettway stood behind the receptionist desk and told me that they couldn’t do anything for me there and “it sounds kind of like MS”. She never did any kind of physical exam, tests, or even had a long conversation with me before coming to this conclusion. It is very unprofessional to tell someone they might have a serious illness such as multiple sclerosis based on a few physical findings. I will never go back.

name: Carol Walden
text: Very little wait!  The Doctor and nurses were so professional and attentive and got me on the road to recovery from Strep Throat!

name: Josh Brooks
text: Refused to see me. Asked if my chest congestion was severe and I said yes that's why I'm here and she said if it's severe you will have to go to the er. Urgent care it's an inaccurate description

name: Clint Deerman
text: Excellent staff and care!

name: Kristin Avis
text: Very efficient and great care!

name: Steven Allison
text: Worst service I have ever seen. Rude front desk receptionist.

name: Kara Myers
text: Fast, courteous and professional service!

name: L B
text: Great thorough doctor!

name: Amanda Valencia
text: The doctor didn't want to see me because I don't live here. I travel for work and am rarely home. I couldn't get medical attention when I needed it because I don't live in this state. Very disappointing that a doctor would turn away someone in need.

name: Alan Bigbee
text: Professional and quick.

name: Tina G.
text: No care provided; waste of time.

name: Freya Renee
text:
I was very disappointed with my encounter here, the staff are awful.
I was referred by my dermatologist to have an X-ray done. I do not have insurance but was fully prepared to pay out of pocket.
The admissions clerk made a spectacle out of me not having insurance, getting her boss to see if they would see me or refuse me service.
Her boss tells me I need to get the specific code so she can look it up, which is literally her job.
She has all of my information and the dermatologist information in front of her and she tells me I have to do it myself, call her for a price, and then come back to get the X-ray.
This entire exchange was very loud and unnecessary, I left in tears.

name: April Rowell
text: Xx is Zaza zzzzzs zdx zzz cc zzz zzzz z. Z s.  Xxx

name: Sister Sabotage13
text: All of the staff have been caring and very attentive. I've never had a better stay in a hospital. The food leaves a but to be desired but I feel like I'll be great. It started in the er and now I've been in for 3 days. I'm getting great care. I couldn't ask for a better experience

name: Lisa Marie
text: DO NOT COME HERE FOR AN EMERGENCY. We were passing through and a family member had a serious seizure nearby. He was puking in the waiting room and no one cleaned it up. They said "housekeeping is gone for the day." The nurse wasn't wearing scrubs or a mask. Patient was barely able to communicate and they kicked his spouse out of the exam room. They attempted to kick the spouse out of the hospital completely, saying "no visitors." Refused to let family communicate with patient to gauge his decision-making abilities and kept saying he was fine, even though they had to come out to the waiting room to ask about meds and medical conditions because he couldn't communicate this information!! Place is filthy, please Alabama do something about your rural healthcare.

name: classic rock Kelley
text: I was so so sad to hear that this hospital 🏥 was closing. One of the best there was. Would have my loved ones there over Troy, Greenville and Luverne. Doctors and Staff were like Family.

name: Will Weider
text:
This community is lucky to have a quality local hospital and emergency room. They have great staff and provide personalized care.

When I was there the hospital leaders were serving nachos to the employees. I think this reflects the caring culture of the organization.

name: Talisa Reaves
text: Although we had a 3 hour visit, the staff was  phenomenal!!!! We had the sweetest nurses that actually took the time to talk to my children to keep from being scared and to help them feel better about our visit. My boys we’re running high fever and hurting all over, the staff immediately tested them. Our nurse was very gentle with my children during the nose and throat swabs that my 4 and 7 yr old didn’t even cry or flinch.  They ended up having the flu and one of our nurses even brought them suckers. All during this time they were serving 6 other patients for way more serious conditions. It meant so much to me that even though they were working under a lot of stress they still treated my children like their pediatrician would have.

name: Kiamonte Gulley
text: THE WORST HOSPITAL IN THE STATE DO NOT GO IF YOU ARE IN EMERGENCY NEED !!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: Thomas Schofield
text: This review has been in waiting for years! Thank God for Google Dr Nami almost killed my dad in critical care due to neglect and negligence on her part I will not retire in Alabama instead Michigan thank God I will never see the inside of this band aid hospital

name: Daniel Taylor
text: Waited 4.5 hours for lower back pain from bulging disc flare up. Was never asked about my meds so I told the doctor that I was already taking nsaids and muscle relaxers daily as he rushed out of my room after 30 seconds. They bring me a muscle relaxer and an nsaid! When I asked the doctor about it, he said he NEVER gives anything more than that for pain. Uncaring ER staff who will not treat you pain.

name: lee black
text: Do not go here they will take you to court over the smallest amount of money and then if you still don’t pay they will garnish your wages. They are relentless when it come to pursuing you.

name: Isabella S
text:
There is a nurse there named “Troy” who has no bedside manner whatsoever and is unapologetic when addressed.
Definitely shouldn’t be working there.

name: Michael Owens
text: This place doesn't even deserve a star. Been here almost 2 1/2 hrs and haven't even seen doctor for a large gash in my 3 yr olds head.

name: Roger Mulnix
text: Sitting here almost 3 hrs and ain't been seen yet, website says 30minute pledge..just wondering when that kicks in?

name: kerri sanfilippo
text: Taking forever to see my ole man he might of had an heart attack

name: Brandon Hinson
text: Horrible service and horrible attitudes I think I would rather take my chances on making it to Montgomery during a life threating experience

name: JoAnna Hall
text: Slowest hospital EVER.

name: FRANBAR PRODUCTIONS
text: Saved my Life

name: Raymond Yarbrough
text: Great place it helps so many people who don't have insurance and they now have a low-cost dental clinic. I have insurance but I know a lot of people that don't in this place is a lifesaver for them their medications are even reduced in price so most people with any income especially those with very low income can't get there life saving medication without spending every time they have

name: James Sullivan

name: Brandy Reynolds
text: I went here nearly 5 months ago after a bad spat of bronchitis, upper respiratory infection and lung infection. I had a horrible cough during that and developed a hard pressure in the upper center part of my stomach which is pushing on my ribs and heart (possibly vagus nerve) I explained all of this to the doctor that I seen and told him I was having problems breathing since it started, much worse when I sat down. I also explained to this doctor that I had been taking meds for migraines but had ran out and needed a refill. Once this doctor found out I was a smoker, he seemed to not even care at all. He blamed everything on smoking. I had my 12 year old son in the room at the time and this doctor literally drew a graph of how long I was going to live on the bed paper. He terrified my son!!! I knew then I'd never see that man again! Instead of checking to see what the pressure was and instead of refilling a med I had been taking for 12 years he put me on Buspar. The first night I took that Buspar the pressure increased so bad I could hardly move! I'm also now having to take bp meds since all of this. I'm 34 years old, I should not have all of this going on and for it to hit like it did all at once. And instead of this doctor trying to help me he terrified my son! He also prescribed me Naproxen which luckily I didn't take because I went to St. Vincent where they done at egd and found I have chronic gastritis as well as reflux esophagitis so the Naproxen could have caused a stomach bleed... I've seen another doctor here who is better than the first but I am still having the same issues. I'm honestly believing a stuck hiatal hernia or something else has been missed. The new doc put me on zantac which didn't help either. I feel no better, in fact I feel worse than when I did when I went to try and get help here about 5 months ago. As far as the staff, nurses and other docs they are great. The first doc I saw I would not recommend to my worst enemy!

name: 2k tips
text: So sitting in the waiting room of St. Vincent’s Blount waiting on my appointment. All of a sudden the receptionist, patients and staff are running screaming at me to run down the hall. They scream over the intercom code silver. I get up and start going down the hall. The first waiting room I came to was x-ray. The staff inside locks the door and I’m tapping on the window to find out what’s going on. Just so happens I know one of the woman working there. A gentleman asks her if she knows me and she replies yes. They slip me a note through the door telling me to call them in 15 minutes. I hear a woman inside say get forceful and tell him to leave. I turn to look down the hall and every soul is gone except for me and the man who stole a gun out of a car in the parking lot. I had no idea where he was. No one would help me or tell me what was going on. I was locked out in the hallway that is at least 80 yards long by myself with no means to defend myself. The man was obviously sick and out of his mind. I saw him when I pulled up and he gave me an uneasy feeling. I was not scared for me but thought to myself what if an elderly/young woman or a child walked in the door behind him what would they do. The only thing I could think to use to defend my self was a chair that was sitting in the radiology waiting area. I said to myself he will probably shoot me but hopefully I can beat him enough with the chair that he couldn’t hurt anyone else. I was starring down the hall waiting for him to walk/run towards me and I was going to do my best to stop him with a chair. Another thought I had was if I had my gun on me I would at least be in a better position to defend myself. Luckily the police got there and disarmed the man. I was so mad at the hospital staff for telling me to run down the hall and then locking me out of EVERYTHING. I was nothing more than a target at that point. I could understand their policy a little better if I hadn’t been waiting for 45 minutes in the same chair they ask me to flee from while rushing other patients into offices to protect them from a possibility bad outcome. I asked the Administrator what was the big plan for me. Wait till he shoots me then scurry on over to the E.R. All he said was this is not supposed to happen here. Needless to say I am extremely, extremely disappointed in the way St. Vincent’s Blount handled things today!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Complete negligence for patient care!

I have Dysautonomia and require IV fluids , if Gatorade and water worked I would not be coming to the ER. It is a well  known fact that in the area,  he is a horrible doctor, most call friends to see if he is on call and avoid to go if he is there. I can say being an Army for many years , seen dozens of doctor’s he is the absolute worse I ever encountered. You have a 50 percent chance of getting a good nurse.

text: Family member admitted for extended stay for rehabilitation due to repair of broken hip. I spend 5 days here helping care for her. The dietary staff staff were so quick to bring a different item if we asked for it. The meals provided were well prepared and delivered with a smile. The RNs were precious: Madison, Haley, & Hazel showed pure loving care and were so patience even when we seems to be pressing that “call button” every 5 minutes. The case manager went above and beyond to keeps us informed about what needs we might have in the future. There is an obvious Godly spirit guiding the workers and medical staff here at St. Vincent’s Blount. I will never forget the kindness and love shown to my family. And they have free wi-fi.

name: Amber Allen
text: I would not suggest this hospice company to anyone who cares about the terminally ill patient. Our nurse hasn’t answered our phone calls on the first call yet. Thankfully my father was only on hospice 5 days before passing on. The morning he passed, we couldn’t even get someone to answer the “emergency” number. I got in touch with an operator and she transferred me to another extension, who  didn’t answer either. My father passed at 9:30am on a Thursday, so anyone who has a loved one pass at an odd time of day my heart breaks for you because you will be looking at your deceased loved one for an extended amount of time. Once my father passed (at a rather young age) naturally my mom wanted the hospice bed out of her living room. On day two after his passing, we called frequently throughout the day about the equipment being picked up, after being assured it would be. At 6:30pm on day two, my husband called again to ask when the equipment would be gone and the lady said not today and hung up on my husband after he explained to her the equipment would now be outside for them. This is not the kind of experience you want when losing your father.

text:
I had two  heart tests scheduled with the Birmingham Heart Clinic at St. Vincent's Blount as well as a stress test to be done at St. Vincent's Blount on April 29th.
I reported to BHC for the two heart tests and was told the tech who did the tests was not available that day for some reason.  I came back to the hospital later that morning for my stress test.  Heidi did the stress test.  She learned that I had been unable to complete the other tests by the BHC tech that morning.  She said that the hospital had had a cancellation that day and asked me if I wanted the hospital tech to do my tests to save me another trip.  I agree and she called and set up the other tests for me and they were completed in a timely manner.  I wish to commend Heidi for the  way that she handled my stress test and also for going the extra mile to get my other tests handled the same day.

resp.text: Dalton Wester, thank you for sharing your observations with us. Feedback helps us know what we’re doing right or where we need to improve.

name: Janet Holloway
text: They need to ask for the visitors information when patient goes in the back room

name: Shannon Nappier Reynolds
text: My son went in with a very itchy rash that kept spreading. He was sent home with prescriptions for three different diagnosis. He visited the health department with a friend and was diagnosed with scabies. Recently a close friend has had several abdominal pain, she was told she needed to loose weight after waiting 8 hours to be seen. I rushed my son to the ER for sizures he's started having with his diabetes he could barely walk. I was told had I called an ambulance they could have got him straight back sooner for us to take a seat. Thirty minutes went by and I had to show myself to get the nurse to come to the waiting room. The nurse flipped out when his sugars were so low that the readings didn't register. The lady at the desk just acted as if she just hates her job.

text: Would give 5 if nurses came around to check up on patients a little more often!  Usually don't see anyone (unless i call, that i don't like doing for everything little thing) sometimes 3 hours.   Great, friendly, and caring staff!!

Also I took my wife there about a year and a half ago we sat in the waiting room for 6 1/2 hrs only to be billed by the Dr. for treatment we never received. We are planning to report the Dr. To both Medicare and Medicaid and BC/BS for false charge's because the Dr. Refuses to fix the Bill.

name: Alicia Mena
text:
Came in about 1am, empty ER. Taken back immediately for my five year old.

Nurses were curteous and nice. However, Dr. Scott 'I'm an arrogant prick' Davidson seemed, very unconcerned about my daughter.

Ordered Blood and urine analysis and CT, milk what you can from Medicaid, I guess.

It's currently 4am, and still no type of diagnosis or input from the doctor.

It's reasons like this people avoid hospitals🏥.

resp.text: Hello, Kyle. Please call (205) 939-7264 so we can address your concerns. We try very hard to meet expectations and we regret that we have not done so in this case.

Doctor told me to change laundry detergent because that's how it spreads.😂😂 will never go there again.

resp.text: Hi, Amber. Thank you for taking the time to share this information. I have forwarded this comment to our leadership. Please feel free to send your contact information and any additional details to feedbackAL@ascension.org.

text: I have brought my sons to this ER multiple times for stitches, broken bones, and a concussion over the past few years. She didn't know but really wanted us to check in to generate a bill for my insurance. Bad Old Lady 😈!!!

text: have not been able to stay awake for days and nights, high temp, unable to eat. i am a diabetic. my sugar levels  have been 121 or lower for months. the first thing Dr Thomas asked was if i was diabetic. This ER is a JOKE and been for as long as I can remember. he Dr came back and said my sugar was fine that I needed to schedule a appointment with my PCP.  needless yo say I left saying a few choice words that the whole er could hear.

name: Khalil Caldwell
text:
I went here a urine screen and was initially treated great by a young man that took my sample and acted professionally.
Unfortunately upon calling a week or so later was greeted by a very unhappy, frankly rude female receptionist. I asked if there was a result for my test and she then mocked me saying, “If didn’t pay for the screen then they own my urine” (laughing in condescending tone).
I understand that these offices have no incentive to treat their patients with respect because companies usually pay for their services; however, it was unusual to be treated disrespectfully out of the blue by a stranger that was probably having a bad day.
Good luck if you are an employee having to deal with this company. 👎🏽👎🏽

text: I went to this facility to have labs done. I was sent here by my doctor. The company charged me a fee that wasn’t supposed to be charged, did not complete all my labs, did not even have all the labs that were requested by my doctor. My doctor then reached out to them advising me that they were not supposed to charge me anything. Was advised that they were to be issuing me a refund to call them to go pick it up and was treated horribly as if I had done something wrong. The lady who answered the phone had a nasty attitude and talked sassy to me. I don’t recommend this facility nor would I ever visit here again.

name: Emily Kunkler
text:
We visited this wonderful hospital from out of town tonight as we were passing through to go to Florida for our vacation. My almost 4 year old was having an allergic reaction to something he shouldn’t have eaten and I have nothing but great things to say. We were greeted with a smile from the person checking patients temps at the door. Walked directly to the desk to get checked in and met another smiling face. Next the nurse doing vitals was very nice and friendly.  Our nurse Aida was SOOO sweet to my little boy and even gave him two prizes for being so good. He was so excited to give it to his brother when he got back to the hotel. (Reminded me of the old days when I went to the ER 25 years ago and got a stuffed animal that I still have to this day.) Dr. Gore was in the room before I even had time to sit down and was very kind, reassuring, and professional as well! Our little boy was okay too. Given some Benadryl and we were back to the hotel within an hour of leaving.

This experience was a great example of what people and hospitals should be like! Thank you!!!!

name: Ann McAnnally
text: I will not be seeing Dr. Kissel again. Worse 'patient/dr. manners I have encountered' I have been having excruciating pain in left knee, sleepless nights and misery for about 3 weeks. He was highly recommended, upon arrival they made one front board x-ray of knee after I told them explicitly it was the right inside of left knee. I am a very healthy 84 yr old, just had raving reports from primary Dr. this week on my lab work, agility and very active lifestyle. Dr. Kissels words to me were that's an old 80 year old knee, some arthritis. Take tylenol and get an otc cream. I asked if it could be a torn miniscus he said probably but that knee is old with a lot of miles. No mention of mri or further ckg into it. I could walk 2-5 miles with no limp before this onset, don't take pain pills, have not been admitted to any hospital since 1976 ,clean my own gutters, horseback ride etc. He repeatedly referred to my old knee. Well I plan to use these 'old knees' for several more years to play t ball and dollhouse in the floor with my great grands. Needless to say I cancelled my appt. to go back in two weeks, I heard him loud and clear about my old knees.  Love St. Vincent's Hospital this is totally about the one doctor.

He found this little hospital and I did wait in a gurney in the hall for a few hours but there were no open rooms in the ER, and although I felt like it I was not dieing. Tests were run and IV fluids and meds were administered. I was admitted and had to spend the night but I really am thankful for the ER Dr and nurses who helped me. I was treated with dignity & respect even though I was not an "ideal patient" (pulled my IV out once). So if you are in that area and need help, don't hesitate to go to this hospital. Thank you again for the excellent care and love you gave to me in my time of need!

text: I can't say I'm not pleased... Had an abcess and with the swelling being so bad and omg did it hurt, my dentist sent me to the er for antibiotics. Gave me two high mg antibiotics And an injection of toradol for the swelling. Took a lot of Advil, picked up the antibiotics that morning by the afternoon the swelling was down and it felt soooo much better. Was able to get to the dentist and get it taken care of that Wednesday. Only drawback was this was on new years eve and the wait was from 6pm-11pm. Guess that's to be expected though sometimes.

name: Rosalie Pearson
text:
My mom lives in nearby Thorsby while I live in Montgomery. She called me at 11:30pm to say she felt lightheaded, a little dizzy, and had what felt like a slight pressure in her chest. She called the ambulance and the EMT's took her to St. Vincent's to be checked out.

I had left Montgomery immediately after receiving the call and arrived at the hospital minutes after her ambulance had arrived (the EMT's were just bringing out the gurney to their rig when I got there) I went into the Emergency Room, told them why I was there and gave them info on my mom (name, date of birth, address, phone, and reason for admittance). The woman told me they were going to get her in a room and then ask when I could come back. I was the ONLY person in the waiting room. About 20 minutes later she said again that they had her in a room and would see when I could go back. Fifteen minutes after that she said a woman had just gone back to see if I could go back. Needless to say it was over an hour before they let me go back. The worst part is that I had assumed they would at least let my mom know I was there. Even though she had been asking them and voicing concerns about how I had not yet arrived no one from the waiting room told her I was there and none of the nurses back with my mom bothered to check if I had arrived. This was not a far walk either, considering my mom was approx. 30 ft inside the doors from the waiting room I was in.

When I finally did get back to see her she was hooked up to a heart and pulse/ox monitor and they had a fluid IV in. They took her out to get chest X-rays and a CT scan minutes after I got back there. When she returned to the room about 15 minutes later, the nurse that brought her back first said she didn't know how to hook my mom back up to the machine and the IV...then was going to try...then decided no, she would have someone come in and do it. A half hour went by and no one came in to hook her back up. I stepped outside the door and explained that she had not been hooked back up and the nurse at the station said thanks, and they would come in and do it...which they never did. The original doctor she saw was also standing there when I told the nurse and did nothing. You would think if you were monitoring someone who you think may have had a heart attack you would want them hooked up to a monitor.

Finally, the doctor came in a little before 4am and said that the X-rays, and CT scan were just fine, but there were concerns with her blood work (PS no one had ever come in to hook my mom back up to the monitors). The doctor explained there are three types of cardiac enzymes. One that tells if there is actual muscle damage and that they use to determine if you've had a heart attack (which was normal and my mom did not), and two others. One of the extra two was normal and then the doctor said that the third was "significantly higher." She said that could indicate that although she may not have had a heart attack that enzyme could mean there could be something brewing or big That could happen on the horizon. She wanted to admit my mom so she could see the cardiologist in the morning...which we did. Kicker is when the cardiologist came in and looked at the tests he said it was slightly elevated, but nothing that he found alarming.

All in all I just felt like even though the ER was extremely slow, and at times there were 4 or more staff members sitting at the desk area within the ER, the overnight crew seemed fairly insufficient at simple things, like communicating that family members are there, or rehooking a patient back up to monitors and IV's.

name: Tony Blackmon
text: Unsafe environment and messy. Too much work for such a low pay. Ideal for high school kids or single people. Watch your back at night. Start off around $ 7.25 and get a quarter raise if you get hired on. Takes forever to get another raise. Go ahead if you want to settle for that shampoo slave work and don't see any good money. Just enough money to gas your car and pay your phone bill and you might have something left to get groceries. The people that's giving this place 4 and 5 stars either live with momma or just don't have any bills or both. Move out on your own and see what i am talking about. Yeah that's shade I just threw. Go to school, that's what I did and I am a successful cook and barber. Smart people would reach for the stars and not settle for shampoo unless hair washing is involved. Just keeping it 100, something most people need to start doing, instead of minding other folks business before their own. Very messy in that place, I would not recommend my daughter to work there because she would cuss them broads out and drag them like they do on the bad girls club. LOL LOL.

name: Evan Burton
text: I’ve known several people that have worked here, if you’re in need of a job be prepared to deal with an unethical, privacy breeching staff. You’ll have to deal with nepotism daily. They won’t put but maybe 50 cent or a dollar over minimum wage to your starting pay, and expect professional performance. DONT BOTHER APPLYING! You’re better off working fast food than this place.

name: Heavenly Newton
text: Staff is very disrespectful.  When you have a complaint they don't handle it professionally. Floor supervisor shows favoritism to certain employees.  Staff harasses you and there is really no one you can go to. Night shift quality control sleeping on the job. Not a good work environment.
